alert.note: Alert for Dade; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 8:11PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Walker and Dade Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 811 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Stephensville to 6 miles southeast of Sulpher Springs, and moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Stephensville, Rising Fawn, Cloudland Canyon State Park and New England. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
